keyword: how many calories in fried egg
title: How Many Calories Are in a Fried Egg?
meta_description: Discover how many calories in fried egg, including protein, fat, carbs, full nutrition breakdown, and preparation tweaks for better tracking.
h1: How Many Calories Are in a Fried Egg?
assumptions: Large egg (~50 g), fried in 1 tsp vegetable oil, sunny-side up, no added salt or seasonings.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by egg size, oil type/amount, cooking time, and pan; values approximate. Check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: One large fried egg provides ~92 kcal and ~6.3 g protein.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Fried in non-stick pan with no oil
Add 1 tsp butter instead of oil

faqs.q: How many calories in one fried egg?
faqs.a: About 92 kcal for a large fried egg in minimal oil.

faqs.q: What's the protein in a fried egg?
faqs.a: Roughly 6.3 g protein per large fried egg.

faqs.q: Does frying add more calories than boiling?
faqs.a: Yes, due to absorbed oilâ€”fried is ~92 kcal vs. ~78 kcal boiled.

faqs.q: How much fat is in a fried egg?
faqs.a: About 7 g total fat, including 2 g saturated, from yolk and oil.

faqs.q: Can I reduce calories in a fried egg?
faqs.a: Use a non-stick pan without oil to drop to ~52 kcal, or opt for poached/boiled.
